This is a dumb question. The only reason I say it is Precedence Diagramming Method over Arrow is because if you google the two, Precedence is the only one that actually mentions a "node". Doesn't look like Arrow contains nodes.

Arrow Diagramming Method
Arrow Diagram is also known as Activity on Arrow diagram. As the name indicates, activities are represented on arrows in this method.

Precedence Diagramming Method
Precedence diagram is also known as Activity on Node diagram and as the name indicates activities are represented on nodes in this method. Boxes are referred to as nodes.

D is the correct answer

The precedence diagram method (PDM) is a tool for scheduling activities in a project plan. It is a method of constructing a project schedule network diagram that uses boxes, referred to as nodes, to represent activities and connects them with arrows that show the dependencies

questions.question_text: Which of the following activity sequencing techniques uses nodes to symbolize activities and arrows to show how their dependencies are connected?
Which of the following activity sequencing techniques uses nodes to symbolize the dependencies of each activity?

discussion.content: An arrow diagram is defined as a process diagramming tool used to determine optimal sequence of events, and their interconnectivity. It is used for scheduling and to determine the critical path through nodes. The arrow diagramming method shows the required order of tasks in a project or process, the best schedule for the entire project, and potential scheduling and resource problems and their solutions. The arrow diagram lets you calculate the "critical path" of the project
